column1: Tweet
@momimbored Thank you for your hard work! It'll take people just like you in their local communities to help us win this. #ForThePeople

We are fighting so younger generations don’t have to grow up in a world where the president spreads hate instead of hope. This campaign is by the people and #ForThePeople. Chip in now. 
https://t.co/ClRsqX2wxE

It’s not just Arizona. Teachers are overworked and underpaid across our country.

They invested in us, it’s time we invested in them. My plan would give the average teacher a $13,500 raise — the largest investment in teachers in our nation’s history.
https://t.co/HbQEZzKgEm

Reforming the money bail system in America is a criminal and economic justice issue. People sit in jail in America every day simply because they don’t have money to afford bail, while those with means are able to get out. It’s unjust and must change.

Trump’s assault on refugees is un-American. Turning our backs on those fleeing violence and harm means we’ve abandoned our moral leadership on the world stage.
https://t.co/3lm3oEhyu5

Today, we’re excited to launch Young Leaders #ForThePeople. Across the country, young people are breaking barriers and moving our nation forward on their college campuses and in their communities. Be one of the first to join us. https://t.co/8YnDICGe3E

Proud to stand with nurses at Hopkins as they organize with @NationalNurses to fight for the rights of patients to safe care. Hopkins must respect their right to organize without interference.
https://t.co/YdNhaT1bPD
The only path to justice for the people of Puerto Rico is to speak truth against divisive and corrupt leaders. I stand with them as they protest and demand accountability.

It’s been seven years since the mass shooting at the Aurora movie theater in Colorado, and Congress hasn’t done enough. 

No matter where you live, you deserve to feel safe. We can keep guns out of the hands of dangerous people. 

All we need is a president willing to act.

Stay safe this weekend. States across the country will reach dangerously high temperatures. Hydrate, check in on your neighbors and the elderly, and know how to recognize the signs of heat exhaustion.

Middle-class families are struggling to make ends meet while Big Pharma turns record profits. As president, I will require pharmaceutical companies to set fair prices for prescription drugs and tax profits made from abusive drug companies.

Your contribution — no matter how big or small — is the lifeline of our campaign’s organizing efforts. Our campaign is driven by the people and for the people. Chip in now: 
https://t.co/zGFAiP8XRm

Guns are the second leading cause of death for children and teens in America. We must address this crisis. As president, I will take executive action to protect our kids and families from gun violence. 
https://t.co/XQbCQ7tzYi

My Rent Relief Act provides a tax credit to families who spend 30% or more of their income on rent and utilities. We’ve got to make sure that nobody has to work two or three jobs—or cut corners on other basic necessities—just to keep a roof over their head.
@cmclymer Proud to stand with you and the LGBTQ+ community. No one should ever have to fight alone. Stay strong.

I’ll be taking the stage for the second DNC debate on July 31. People just like you across the country are stepping up to host a debate watch party in their community. Sign up and we’ll give you everything you need to host a party of your own.
https://t.co/77aGB3z3f5
@cmclymer Your strength inspires me, @cmclymer. Don't ever stop speaking up.

Millions of families are waking up in the middle of the night trying to figure out how to make ends meet. My 3 AM Agenda would change that.
https://t.co/MNciDK8jtj

Iowa has held a special place in my heart ever since I first visited the state in 2007 to campaign for Barack Obama. I'm excited to announce I’ll be doing a five-day bus tour in August from Sioux City to Davenport. See you on the road! 
https://t.co/NUXv4JS7b8
Let's reject those who are trying to sow hate and division among us and agree we've got to bring our country together. https://t.co/OENsuoQuN7

Cooking goals. 
https://t.co/oYtyp5Khi2

Excited to take the stage again for the second Democratic debate on Wednesday, July 31 on @CNN. I’m ready to share our vision on how we can give American’s a raise, pay our teachers their value, keep guns out of the wrong hands, and fight #ForThePeople.

Pharmaceutical companies flooded our country with 76 billion — yes, billion — opioid pills from 2006 through 2012.

This is wrong. It’s past time we hold pharmaceutical companies accountable.
https://t.co/7tergiCoLr

If we don't address the maternal mortality crisis in our country now, more Black mothers will die. My Maternal CARE Act will address the racial bias in our health care system and ensure better outcomes for women. 
https://t.co/w2xvMlORcS

This is real life: Americans are turning to the black market to be able to afford insulin. This is why I introduced my plan to take on pharmaceutical companies and ensure every American can afford the medicine they need.  
https://t.co/4omw6h3tpf
When president, I will take action to lower the cost of prescription drugs. https://t.co/9hhYNhNp7W

Let’s get this president out of the White House. Donate and we’ll do it together. 
https://t.co/d4PE7cRCOj

The House just voted to move forward with raising the minimum wage to $15 an hour. It’s time we give Americans the raise they deserve. I urge my colleagues in the Senate to bring this bill to the Senate floor.

I said it in Iowa on Tuesday and it’s even more clear after last night: Donald Trump has defiled the office of President of the United States.
https://t.co/t1oAD7s5Od

It’s vile. 
It’s cowardly. 
It’s xenophobic. 
It’s racist. 
It defiles the office of the President. 
And I won't share it here. 

It’s time to get Trump out of office and unite the country.

Black homeowners have been left behind, with homeownership rates falling by 8.6% since 2004. Let's turn the tide. As president, I'll take action to provide $100 billion to four million homebuyers who rent or live in historically red-lined communities.
https://t.co/aO62VnmAja
Glaciers are melting. Sea levels are rising. Climate change is real and we must act before it's too late. That’s why I support a Green New Deal.

Grateful for @serenawilliams' leadership in combating the Black maternal health crisis in America. Black mothers are 3 to 4 times more likely to die from pregnancy-related causes and it's time we came together to address this.
 
Congress must pass my Maternal CARE Act. https://t.co/tSn6nqmZOs

The federal government must get justice for survivors of sexual abuse, assault, and rape. I have a plan to make that a reality. 
https://t.co/53BTkZ1cuF

As AG, I took on the 5 biggest banks in the U.S. who defrauded homeowners during the foreclosure crisis. We won $20B for CA homeowners and passed the strongest anti-foreclosure law in the country. I’ll always take on corporate interests to stand up for working families.

As president, I will protect consumers from high drug prices by:
✅Capping the prices Big Pharma can charge for prescription drugs
✅Holding drug companies accountable for overcharging patients 

It’s time to change the system.
On November 3, 2020, I am going to send Donald Trump back to where he came from. https://t.co/t1oAD7s5Od

.@Ava’s retelling of the Central Park jogger case is a masterpiece. Congratulations to her team and phenomenal cast on a well-deserved 16 Emmy nominations!  
https://t.co/Aoacl0I9O5
Trump attempts to distract from that fact that he’s done nothing for hardworking Americans by flame-throwing. https://t.co/xO5ectQ19j

From breaking codes in World War II to breaking down barriers for civil rights, Justice John Paul Stevens lived up to those words above the Court: Equal Justice Under Law. Our nation was better for his service and we mourn his loss.
I've personally been told, "go back to where you came from." It is vile, ignorant, shallow, and hateful. It has to stop. https://t.co/t1oAD7s5Od

Let’s break this cycle. I will go after these companies who prey on seniors and the sick. Big Pharma should not be winning in Washington, the American people should be.
https://t.co/dL2DMjFTYX

“It’s not your time.”
https://t.co/o8omd3Q8pa

In 2016, over 35 million people with disabilities were eligible to vote, but only 16 million did. It’s imperative we invest time, energy, and money in getting people with disabilities registered and ready to exercise their civil right to vote. https://t.co/sK4CiTPeXY
When we say love your neighbor as yourself, we must expand our definition of neighbor. https://t.co/e0bGFX9OUT
I took on pharmaceutical companies on behalf of the people when I was Attorney General and I'll do it again as president. https://t.co/ek9Ng0JaeQ

This is a miscarriage of justice. Our criminal justice system should be rooted in accountability. My heart breaks for the Garner family.
https://t.co/qwSVbXdzSc

In the past year, nearly one in four Americans said it was difficult for them to afford their medications. This must change. Today, my People Over Profit plan will address drug pricing affordability. https://t.co/98cASgWlGn

One in four U.S. adults live with a disability. Too often, voting is inaccessible. This National Disability Voter Registration Week, I’m committed to ensuring people living with disabilities have their voices heard at the ballot box. #RevUp

Many domestic workers are women or people of color who have not had basic protections afforded to other employees. Today, I've introduced the first-ever National Domestic Workers Bill of Rights to protect these workers.

I stand in solidarity with @Amazon workers who are striking on #PrimeDay. Like all workers, they deserve safe working conditions, fair wages, and dignity and respect from their employer. I am proud of them for standing up for their rights and their families.

This Administration's move to restrict asylum for Central Americans is deliberately cruel. We should embrace our moral responsibility to serve as a safe haven for children and families fleeing violence and persecution.

Our deepest condolences go out to the family & friends of Sadie Roberts-Joseph. Sadie founded the Baton Rouge African-American History Museum and was a rock in the Louisiana community. She will be missed. https://t.co/WSUB1L6nkd
Let’s call these ICE raids what they are. They are a political stunt designed to break up families and spread fear. We are better than this.
Let's call the president’s racist attack exactly what it is: un-American. https://t.co/fDeC5ka01F

An increased ICE presence at schools, courthouses, hospitals, and churches deters immigrants from seeking help from police. That means domestic abuse can often go unreported. This makes everyone less safe.
As ICE raids begin, know your rights. Follow these guidelines from the @ACLU and stay safe. https://t.co/cc4lp5RVw1

Trump’s threat of ICE raids continues to stoke fear in this county. He is using immigrant communities for political gain. This makes us all less safe.
https://t.co/1YSYOTCbUg

Women’s access to reproductive health care is under attack. We’ve seen it in Alabama, where the legislature passed a law to incarcerate a physician for up to 99 years. I am not being dramatic. Women will die because of these policies.

Gun violence is the leading cause of death for young Black men in America. We must stop this. When president, I will take executive action to ensure guns do not fall into the wrong hands. 

It’s not enough to just talk — Americans deserve action.

Here’s where your money goes when you donate to our campaign:
✅Hiring more organizers in early states
✅Keeping our campaign on the road to meet directly with voters
✅Helping me prosecute the case against four more years of Trump 

Chip in today. https://t.co/EdfNS45MPG

.@serenawilliams is right. We must never stop fighting for equality.
https://t.co/eWB5oGL1Bh

The estimated annual cost to clear the nationwide rape kit backlog is less than what we have already spent on Trump’s golf trips. I did it in California as Attorney General — and I’ll do it nationwide as President.
https://t.co/1TEG5U7KIL

More than 5,300 teachers left South Carolina’s public schools ahead of this upcoming school year. 

This is a nationwide crisis -- my plan would close the teacher wage gap and make it possible for educators to stay in their jobs. https://t.co/KHaA33tZPh

In the past few weeks I’ve been on the campaign trail visiting Iowa, Texas, Louisiana, and South Carolina. But in order to meet with more undecided voters, we need you. Chip in $5 now. https://t.co/cB6bQlRrSn
Thinking of everyone in the path of Tropical Storm #Barry. Please be careful, stay safe and listen to any orders to evacuate. https://t.co/ZODOeNky0V

We need a president who will fight for the equality of all Americans and reject hatred and bigotry. That’s why I support the Equality Act. Passing this Act is essential to protecting members of the LGBTQ+ community from being fired because of who they are and who they love.

This election is about a vision for America where everyone can see themselves. I am focused on the issues that wake people up at 3 AM like affordable housing, teacher pay, and health care. https://t.co/YEkOv2Fdng

Instead of helping those who have often fled extreme violence and horror, this Administration is further inflicting mental trauma on immigrant children by keeping them in unsafe conditions. Don’t overlook this human rights abuse. 
https://t.co/C5p3HTO4p4

.@WhoopiGoldberg: How do we get Trump out of office? 

We're going to prosecute the case against four more years of Donald Trump. And there's a long rap sheet. https://t.co/cPix82NDyz

It is troubling, disheartening, and unbelievable to hear how Acosta described the challenges of prosecuting Epstein. If Acosta didn't know how to do his job, he should not have been in the position. https://t.co/BTBK2CW2j2

.@Malala has been an outspoken advocate and champion throughout her life for women and girls to have access to quality education. Her courage inspires me to this day. Happy birthday, Malala! https://t.co/4sY8c0nJtl

“Agents have expressed apprehensions about arresting babies and young children.”
Rounding up thousands of families for mass deportation is wrong. We are about to fail a critical moral test. 
https://t.co/kFRSYuzRkm
Predators bully their victims. They seek to intimidate and instill fear. And let’s be honest: we have a predator living in the White House. https://t.co/nrSgFtq3GF
A crime against one of us is a crime against all of us. https://t.co/UCZmSfcClf
Trump is intentionally trying to create fear among immigrant communities. That is not a sign of a strong president. This is not strength. https://t.co/d01kk9YVuG

We are living through an all-out assault on women’s health and reproductive rights. We need a president who will stand with the overwhelming majority of Americans and fight against Republican attempts to end safe and legal abortion in America. 
https://t.co/xMvvjROh8f

You can judge a society based on how it treats its children. We are failing this moral test. 
https://t.co/DbKvDwJBnG

My plan to clear the rape kit backlog would:
✅Require states to annually report the number of untested rape kits
✅Require testing within a short time frame
✅Give survivors the right to know the status of their rape kits
✅Increase the availability of rape kits nationwide

My plan to close the nationwide rape kit backlog would cost about $2 million less each year than what taxpayers have spent on Trump’s golf trips. It’s time we had someone in the White House who is committed to fighting for survivors, not protecting predators.

.@BetsyDeVosED and the @usedgov have failed to protect student loan borrowers at every turn. It’s time they were held accountable.
https://t.co/hzhSxYgYW2

As California’s Attorney General, I made clearing the backlog of 1,300 untested rape kits at state-run labs a top priority — and we got it done within my first year in office. I announced a plan to dedicate that same focus on the national level.

In the last decade, about 225,000 untested rape kits have been uncovered. Too many survivors aren’t getting the justice they deserve. As president, I'll close the nationwide rape kit backlog by the end of my first term. Predators must be held accountable.
https://t.co/Fc8QNv8ipz

We’re building this campaign from the ground up. I didn’t enter this race with a war chest of campaign funds and I’ve never run for president before. Instead, we’re going door to door building this campaign one conversation at a time. Join us. 
https://t.co/7g1vJ70JKL

We are fighting for the soul — and the future — of our country. Fair pay for our nation’s teachers, Medicare for All, common-sense gun safety reform, and more are all on the line. https://t.co/vm9y3iiAhV
We're building a diverse coalition of Nevadans across the state and I'm thrilled to have @KalieWork on our team! https://t.co/fJWX9vQrYC

I know this may be a tough week for some sexual assault survivors. Please know: We are here for you. We see you. We hear you. If you or anyone you know needs assistance, please contact 1 (800) 656-4673.

Rounding up immigrants, and potentially entire families, is despicable and an assault on our nation's values. Know your rights. https://t.co/cc4lp5RVw1 
https://t.co/gHv371Btmg

Women and women of color deserve to have a seat at the table where decisions are made — and finally, that’s a reality in major cities across our nation. 
https://t.co/9GW0cHMAlA

When nearly a quarter of Americans say they never plan to retire, it couldn’t be more clear: the economy isn’t working for working people. Every American should be able to retire with dignity. Period. 
https://t.co/iT7LZmWKYi

A typical Black family has just $10 of wealth for every $100 held by a white family.

Homeownership has historically been one of the most powerful drivers of wealth, which is why I announced a plan to shrink the gap and help up to 4M families with down payments and closing costs.

Americans deserve a president who is concerned and focused on bettering the lives of the American people. It’s time to turn the page and write a new chapter of our nation. Help us get there. 
https://t.co/GmPQGw9kRg

The other day I stopped by City Food & Spirits in Marion, South Carolina. I heard the stories of the strong, formidable people of this town. Thank you, Marion, for sharing your stories. I will keep them with me as I travel the nation and work #ForThePeople. https://t.co/w8fs7UMTwB

Answered 20 of @nowthisnews' most pressing questions — including my tendency to be a back seat driver.
https://t.co/NEWnhtXMcz

As we celebrate the @USWNT today, it's on us to take up their charge and fight for equal pay. Let's flip the script and hold corporations accountable by requiring them to prove they're not engaging in pay discrimination — and fine companies that fail to close their pay gaps. https://t.co/yydKAm2MYu

After serving their time in our criminal justice system, too many people face additional barriers once they try to reenter society. I introduced a bill with @AOC to ensure formerly incarcerated individuals have access to federal housing assistance. 
https://t.co/ITo2AWyaEZ

Being Black and listening to rap music is not a threat. #JusticeForElijah  
https://t.co/dDQp8TWk26

It’s July 9 and the Violence Against Women Act still has yet to be reauthorized. No more political games. Let’s ensure survivors of sexual assault and domestic violence have access to the care they need.

Poor communities and communities of color are disproportionately affected by issues like air pollution and crumbling water infrastructure. And what is this Administration doing about it? Not enough. We can’t forget places like Flint, Michigan and Denmark, South Carolina.

From day one, I made a promise to run a campaign of the people and for the people. And we’re doing just that. Your support powers everything we do — from how many states we visit to the staff we hire. Chip in now.
https://t.co/nIQZw019Jh

This president has created a culture where people think it’s okay to vilify immigrants and their families. Now we’re seeing human rights abuses being committed by our government at our southern border. #CloseTheCamps
https://t.co/xYdR6LTseq

From the Naval Academy to her historic Marine combat flight to Afghanistan, Iraq and the Pentagon, @AmyMcGrathKY has dedicated her life to serving our country. Thank you for stepping up and continuing your leadership. 
https://t.co/gbtSVwnT19

Discussed everything from the most urgent issues facing women today to how we can combat climate change for future generations (plus, my favorite comfort food!) with @byshondaland. 
https://t.co/pZEOr8Ue0D
Alex Acosta should resign as Labor Secretary. We need leaders committed to fighting for justice for survivors of abuse, not protecting predators.

As California Attorney General, I fought to protect the ACA in court.

As Senator, I’ve fought its repeal at every turn. 

And to the millions of people who depend on the ACA’s protections: as President, I will stop these attacks and fight to expand your care.

We won’t go back. https://t.co/9f82brCJhw

Unbought and unbossed, Shirley Chisholm served as a role model for so many of us. She used her voice to speak for those who otherwise would not have a voice in the political process. It’s time we honor her with a statue in the Capitol.
https://t.co/x6i6n7FwqJ

This weekend at @essencefest, I announced that as president, I’ll make a $100 billion federal investment to put homeownership within reach for those who live in redlined communities.
https://t.co/22nOZUNgYS

When it comes to health care, we can’t leave anybody behind — including the 130 million Americans with pre-existing conditions and 61 million Americans with disabilities. That’s why I support #MedicareForAll.
We need a new commander in chief. https://t.co/d5QvCxLtw7
.@ericswalwell, you're a great fighter for the people of California. We are a stronger nation because of your work to protect our children and our communities from gun violence.

We’re running a campaign made of the people, for the people, and by the people. Not a single dime comes from corporate PACs or federal lobbyists — just people like you. Chip in now:
https://t.co/n1fi6tKI3S

Labor built the middle class. Working people need leaders who will stand with them, and I firmly stand with the 85,000 Kaiser workers who are fighting for a contract that will support their families and communities. #HealthcareJustice

There are always going to be doubters. That’s not new. But you prove them wrong by winning. And I intend to do just that. 
https://t.co/Muq2yOV9qJ

The @USWNT proved even before their World Cup win yesterday that they have what it takes to succeed. They generate more revenue than the men’s team and now hold the record for most FIFA Women’s World Cup wins. The world is watching — it’s time they were paid what they deserve.

Right now, access to reproductive health is under attack in states across America. It is not alarmist to say that women will die because of these restrictive policies — because we’ve seen it happen before. As president, I will work to stop these policies before they become law.

The fight of Black women has always been fueled and grounded in faith and belief in what is possible. 

It’s why Sojourner spoke. 
Why Mae flew.
Why Rosa and Claudette sat.
Why Maya wrote.
Why Fannie organized.
Why Shirley ran. 

And why I am a candidate for President of the U.S.
The 2020 presidential election is a fight not only for the soul of our country, this is also a fight that is borne out of love for country — and this is a fight we will win.
@geraldmalloySC @mayaharris_ @TravRobertson @Bakari_Sellers @Marg_Willis @scdp Thanks for having me!

We must right what is wrong with public health policy and pass #MedicareForAll. 

We must pass my maternal mortality bill so Black women are taken seriously when they arrive at the doctor.

We must treat access to clean drinking water like what it should be — a fundamental right.

#TeamKamala, the second debate is just around the corner and supporters across the country are signing up to host a debate night watch party. We’ll give you all the tools you need to make it a success. Join us.
https://t.co/W1brAaCdBb
Congratulations to our back-to-back World Cup Champions! You make America proud. 📷: @USWNT https://t.co/2LxiCJ2srM

The Chicago Defender has chronicled more than a century of our nation's history — its contribution to social and political change is unparalleled. Although no longer in print, I know they will continue to tell our stories, our way.
https://t.co/6PzLzcbLNh

There is so much at stake in the 2020 election. We need a fighter on that stage, ready to take on Trump. I know how to fight. 
https://t.co/hhf2RgyN78

We can’t ignore that Black mothers across the country are facing a health crisis, driven in part by implicit bias in our health care system. My Maternal CARE Act would address this urgent issue and ensure women's health concerns are listened to and taken seriously.

I’ve met too many teachers who are working 2-3 jobs, who stay up late worrying about how they’re going to pay the bills, instead of tomorrow’s lesson plan. As president, I’ll make the largest federal investment in teacher pay in U.S. history to help close the teacher pay gap.
The fight of Black women has always been fueled and grounded in faith and in the belief of what is possible. #EssenceFest https://t.co/iSsSIJesFo

Homeownership has historically been one of the most powerful drivers of wealth, which is why I announced a plan to shrink the racial homeownership gap, helping up to four million families with down payments and closing costs.
https://t.co/C9GoIuyVA7
Today, at #EssenceFest, I released a new plan to start closing the racial wealth gap in our country. https://t.co/CZfuDPiDRl

Sometimes people say, “Kamala, talk to me about Black people’s issues.” And I’ll smile and say, you know — let’s talk about the economy. Let’s talk about health care. Let’s talk about the racial wealth gap. Let’s talk about national security. #EssenceFest

HBCUs made me who I am today. #EssenceFest
https://t.co/vY1oz7ihpj

After generations of discrimination, it’s time to give Black families a real shot at homeownership — historically one of the most powerful drivers of wealth. My new policy will remove unfair barriers Black Americans face when they go to qualify for a home loan. #EssenceFest

Today at @essencefest, I announced that as president, I’ll invest $100 billion to put homeownership within reach for up to 4 million families. We must close the homeownership gap. 
https://t.co/BVaxcmXplH

The purpose of the census is to get a full and accurate count of the U.S. population. Adding a citizenship question to the census is nothing more than a blatant attempt to undermine that and weaponize the census. We won’t stand for it. 
https://t.co/3BpEDq1YFN

Congratulations on your comeback, @CocoGauff. You’re an inspiration and we’re cheering you on! 
https://t.co/EgU2QtPbBI

Thankful for California's first responders who work tirelessly to protect lives and property. Now is a good time to make sure you're prepared for a future earthquake. https://t.co/yeutWM41Dy 
https://t.co/wEQDVZUXrb

Everyone should have access to a good job, dignified wages, and a roof over their head. On these issues, I won’t just talk: I’ll act. My Rent Relief Act will guarantee more money in families’ pockets who are struggling with rent.

“If you’re a woman, your life is political whether you like it or not.” 
https://t.co/K6LrhgLI9A
Congress has failed to protect our students and teachers from gun violence. But I won't — I'll take action. #StrongPublicSchools https://t.co/EKZzb6sb5S

Shackling pregnant women is inhumane and must come to an end. That’s why my colleagues in the Senate and I have a bill to stop this abuse and protect the health and safety of all pregnant women. 
https://t.co/BE9ZyrjH6g

Today at our Sioux City Town Hall, an audience member asked how we can help the kids at the border and their families. Here are a few organizations doing great work to provide support.
https://t.co/x01boa6Fvi
There were so many people at our most recent town hall we had people waiting outside! Thank you for coming. I’m so glad we were able to spend a few moments together. https://t.co/8Saypt96SM

This is outrageous. 
https://t.co/C3vxg4jmdZ

As president, I will immediately put in place a meaningful process to review asylum cases. I will release children from cages. I will get rid of the private detention centers. It’s time we had a president whose actions reflected the values of our country.

I've prosecuted the pharmaceutical companies. I’ve prosecuted transnational criminal organizations.

I know predators and we have a predator living in the White House.
https://t.co/hBfutcrfGo

On this day in 1992, one of my heroes and inspirations Thurgood Marshall gave a speech that still resonates to this day: “Democracy just cannot flourish amid fear. Liberty cannot bloom amid hate. Justice cannot take root amid rage. America must get to work.” So let’s get to work.

Thinking of those in Southern California affected by the earthquake and our brave first responders helping to keep people safe.
https://t.co/IyuVBwt6aM

As we sit down with our friends and family to celebrate America’s independence, let’s recommit ourselves to ensuring all of our veterans get the proper physical and mental health care they have earned with their service. We owe them nothing less.

This Independence Day, and every day, I’m thankful for our brave servicemembers who fight to uphold our country’s freedom and values. Fueled by a love of country and optimism in what we can be, I know we can create a better nation for all. #FourthOfJuly

Reminder: Puerto Ricans are Americans. 
https://t.co/A9twfzxyqF

Nurses care for, protect, and advocate for patients. They always have our backs — we must have theirs. Retaliation against those who advocate for fair and safe workplaces must not be tolerated. I stand in solidarity with the @OhioNursesAssoc and @AFTUnion.
https://t.co/RtFW0aTbut

This Administration has proven over and over that they will turn back the clock on our reproductive rights if we let them. We cannot go back to the days before Roe v. Wade when women were dying from unsafe abortions. Under my Administration, we will protect access to health care.
I know predators and we have one living in the White House. https://t.co/YKbUdTvvlW

We just added some new events coming up this weekend, including @essencefest, multiple town halls in South Carolina, and more. RSVP now to join me on the campaign trail→
https://t.co/2HxdSnfUOz

Children with no access to showers. 
Kids sleeping on concrete floors. 
A man holding a note that says, "Help. 40 Day Here."
